intro: Microstylis prasina, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine in some regions. Microstylis prasina plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
